{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3267495,"name":"viggy96","username":"viggy96","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/viggy96/{size}/252784_2.png","created_at":"2023-12-20T16:06:36.569Z","cooked":"

Unfortunately, REVLib and Spark Maxes exhibit some unreliability when it comes to setting some parameters and using burnFlash(). At a minimum you’ll want to sleep the thread before and after you call burnFlash() for each and every Spark Max on your robot. There is a convenient method for doing this in WPILib, Timer.delay(seconds).
Ideally, you’d also check every parameter that you set, using its respective “getter”, and retry your burnFlash() until the parameters are all set correctly.

I’ve done this in my custom library, PurpleLib. Feel free to use it for inspiration, or in your own projects.

GitHub

GitHub - lasarobotics/PurpleLib: Custom library for 418 Purple Haze

Custom library for 418 Purple Haze. Contribute to lasarobotics/PurpleLib development by creating an account on GitHub.

I address checking errors in YAGSL but don’t check parameters yet, here is an easy snippet for checking errors and retrying for those who want it.

github.com

BroncBotz3481/YAGSL-Example/blob/main/src/main/java/swervelib/motors/SparkMaxSwerve.java#L79-L94


      
    
          
  1. /**
    2. 
          
  2.  * Run the configuration until it succeeds or times out.
    3. 
          
  3.  *
    4. 
          
  4.  * @param config Lambda supplier returning the error state.
    5. 
          
  5.  */
    6. 
          
  6. private void configureSparkMax(Supplier<REVLibError> config)
    7. 
          
  7. {
    8. 
          
  8.   for (int i = 0; i < maximumRetries; i++)
    9. 
          
  9.   {
    10. 
          
  10.     if (config.get() == REVLibError.kOk)
    11. 
          
  11.     {
    12. 
          
  12.       return;
    13. 
          
  13.     }
    14. 
          
  14.   }
    15. 
          
  15.   DriverStation.reportWarning("Failure configuring motor " + motor.getDeviceId(), true);
    16. 
          
  16. }
    17.

I also sleep before burning the flash but I am not sure I need to afterwards?

github.com

BroncBotz3481/YAGSL-Example/blob/main/src/main/java/swervelib/motors/SparkMaxSwerve.java#L315-L328


      
    
          
  1. /**
    2. 
          
  2.  * Save the configurations from flash to EEPROM.
    3. 
          
  3.  */
    4. 
          
  4. @Override
    5. 
          
  5. public void burnFlash()
    6. 
          
  6. {
    7. 
          
  7.   try
    8. 
          
  8.   {
    9. 
          
  9.     Thread.sleep(200);
    10. 
          
  10.   } catch (Exception e)
    11. 
          
  11.   {
    12. 
          
  12.   }
    13. 
          
  13.   configureSparkMax(() -> motor.burnFlash());
    14. 
          
  14. }
    15.

Your library looks pretty awesome too!

It’s helpful to sleep afterwards as well, just in case the user does some other Spark Max related function, because burnFlash “deafens” the motor controller, and it won’t get any settings you try to set for a while.

This seems very similar to an issue and solution I had to figure out last year with CTRE CANcoders.

Just as an FYI, this was improved with the Phoenix 6 API, you can do effectively all that with a cancoder.getPosition().waitForUpdate(2.0) call, this is one of the reasons we developed a synchronous API in Phoenix 6 to begin with.

This prevents any potential race caused by the rest of the system catching up.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2023-12-20T18:28:36.413Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":6,"reads":199,"readers_count":198,"score":129.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":446650,"topic_slug":"psa-check-parameters-and-retry-burnflash-with-thread-sleeps-on-spark-maxes-to-make-sure-parameters-are-being-set-as-intended","display_username":"Cory","primary_group_name":"CTRE","flair_name":"CTRE","flair_url":"/uploads/default/original/3X/1/b/1bd2b430e1bb6427d1c6504ff6abcd31de851a6d.png","flair_bg_color":"","flair_color":"","flair_group_id":57,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":12688,"username":"JohnFogarty","name":"John Fogarty","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/johnfogarty/{size}/267052_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":26269,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"7762 Mentor, CTRE Engineer, CSA"},"post_url":"/t/psa-check-parameters-and-retry-burnflash-with-thread-sleeps-on-spark-maxes-to-make-sure-parameters-are-being-set-as-intended/446650/5","custom_user_title":"7762 Mentor, CTRE Engineer, CSA","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3267579,"name":"Will Toth","username":"Will_Toth","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/will_toth/{size}/111117_2.png","created_at":"2023-12-20T19:45:00.921Z","cooked":"

I’ve posted a before about this issue, and we also have a wrapper library. Some thoughts on what you posted:

  1. In most cases, you can just check the return code from whatever parameter setting call to verify if the parameter was set correctly. I think setInverted is the exception since it is an override, but you can work around this.
  2. Only call burn flash after all the parameters have returned kOk, don’t call it if they don’t. I would not call burnFlash in a loop like you have it.
  3. You shouldn’t call burn flash after every parameter, especially if you’re going to be pausing your thread for >1s. Your initialization is going to take for every for each motor. Instead, just call burn flash after you set all the parameters you care about.

Just one other note, I’ve only really seen this issue when there is a high number of devices on the bus, or when the CAN bus is a bit shaky electrically.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2023-12-20T19:50:26.034Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":13,"reads":186,"readers_count":185,"score":122.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":446650,"topic_slug":"psa-check-parameters-and-retry-burnflash-with-thread-sleeps-on-spark-maxes-to-make-sure-parameters-are-being-set-as-intended","display_username":"Will Toth","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/neo-not-working-during-practice-match/407018","internal":true,"reflection":false,"title":"Neo not working during practice match","clicks":16}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":6349,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC 3005 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/psa-check-parameters-and-retry-burnflash-with-thread-sleeps-on-spark-maxes-to-make-sure-parameters-are-being-set-as-intended/446650/6","custom_user_title":"FRC 3005 Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3267582,"name":"viggy96","username":"viggy96","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/viggy96/{size}/252784_2.png","created_at":"2023-12-20T19:55:54.990Z","cooked":"

This might just be anecdotal with REVLib 2024, but I did originally only call burnFlash() once after all settings are set (as is commonly recommended), but it didn’t improve the behavior. Once I made it flash after (almost) every setting with a wait, I only had a single parameter on a single Spark Max not flash correctly (it was a different Spark each time, so I couldn’t narrow it down to a specific motor controller). Before, basically every Spark Max on the MAXSwerve drivetrain was problematic.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2023-12-20T19:56:39.329Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":171,"readers_count":170,"score":44.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":446650,"topic_slug":"psa-check-parameters-and-retry-burnflash-with-thread-sleeps-on-spark-maxes-to-make-sure-parameters-are-being-set-as-intended","display_username":"viggy96","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":6349,"username":"Will_Toth","name":"Will Toth","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/will_toth/{size}/111117_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24613,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"418 Mentor | Tries to be smart"},"post_url":"/t/psa-check-parameters-and-retry-burnflash-with-thread-sleeps-on-spark-maxes-to-make-sure-parameters-are-being-set-as-intended/446650/7","custom_user_title":"418 Mentor | Tries to be smart","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3267586,"name":"Will Toth","username":"Will_Toth","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/will_toth/{size}/111117_2.png","created_at":"2023-12-20T20:08:09.607Z","cooked":"

How many Spark Maxes did you have on the CAN bus? If its only 8 on a basic chassis you shouldn’t have this issue, unless there is something electrically wrong on the bus. Did you happen to look at the CAN diagnostics? Your description of the issue sounds like something else. For context, in that thread I linked, with 20 Spark Maxes, we only saw an invalid parameter set once every 10-20 power ons of the bot.

During your test were you checking the return code for the set parameter call? The reason I ask is there might be a slight misunderstanding of the purpose of burnFlash. You don’t have to call it for the parameter to be set, the parameters are set immediately. In fact, you could skip burn flash entirely if you are setting all the parameters on boot. If a parameter was not set correctly on the controller its due to the parameter call itself.

The call to burnFlash just makes it so if you lose power, the parameter values are restored.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2023-12-20T20:08:09.607Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":170,"readers_count":169,"score":44.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":446650,"topic_slug":"psa-check-parameters-and-retry-burnflash-with-thread-sleeps-on-spark-maxes-to-make-sure-parameters-are-being-set-as-intended","display_username":"Will Toth","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":24613,"username":"viggy96","name":"viggy96","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/viggy96/{size}/252784_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":6349,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC 3005 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/psa-check-parameters-and-retry-burnflash-with-thread-sleeps-on-spark-maxes-to-make-sure-parameters-are-being-set-as-intended/446650/8","custom_user_title":"FRC 3005 Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3267590,"name":"viggy96","username":"viggy96","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/viggy96/{size}/252784_2.png","created_at":"2023-12-20T20:20:09.190Z","cooked":"

Yes I only had 8 Sparks on the robot. And I see, that is a misunderstanding. It was unclear to me if the settings required burnFlash to apply, or if they are applied immediately.

For the CAN diagnostics, is that in the REV Hardware Client?

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2023-12-20T20:22:23.421Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":161,"readers_count":160,"score":37.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":446650,"topic_slug":"psa-check-parameters-and-retry-burnflash-with-thread-sleeps-on-spark-maxes-to-make-sure-parameters-are-being-set-as-intended","display_username":"viggy96","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":6349,"username":"Will_Toth","name":"Will Toth","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/will_toth/{size}/111117_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24613,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"418 Mentor | Tries to be smart"},"post_url":"/t/psa-check-parameters-and-retry-burnflash-with-thread-sleeps-on-spark-maxes-to-make-sure-parameters-are-being-set-as-intended/446650/9","custom_user_title":"418 Mentor | Tries to be smart","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3267593,"name":"Will Toth","username":"Will_Toth","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/will_toth/{size}/111117_2.png","created_at":"2023-12-20T20:28:35.965Z","cooked":"
viggy96:

For the CAN diagnostics, is that in the REV Hardware Client?

I typically use the CAN tab of the driver station. This is data I wish was logged, but its good that the tab is there at least.

viggy96:

Once I made it flash after (almost) every setting with a wait

The other disadvantage here is that EEPROM can only be written a finite number of times. Modern EEPROM/dataFLASH is pretty good-- upwards of 10k cycles, I think-- but there’s no point wasting erase cycles that you don’t need to, especially if you reuse Sparks from season to season.

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2023-12-20T22:29:58.707Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":122,"readers_count":121,"score":34.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":446650,"topic_slug":"psa-check-parameters-and-retry-burnflash-with-thread-sleeps-on-spark-maxes-to-make-sure-parameters-are-being-set-as-intended","display_username":"viggy96","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24613,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"418 Mentor | Tries to be smart"},"post_url":"/t/psa-check-parameters-and-retry-burnflash-with-thread-sleeps-on-spark-maxes-to-make-sure-parameters-are-being-set-as-intended/446650/12","custom_user_title":"418 Mentor | Tries to be smart","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3267686,"name":"Allen Nuttle","username":"nuttle","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nuttle/{size}/124105_2.png","created_at":"2023-12-20T22:58:07.850Z","cooked":"

C++, but this has been rock solid: https://github.com/Jagwires7443/Scrappy/blob/master/src/main/cpp/infrastructure/SparkMax.cpp.

It checks and sets all parameters while the robot is in disabled state, and it paces things to avoid congesting the CAN bus. We only burn flash in test mode, when a dashboard button is clicked. This works well enough that it’s no big deal if the settings aren’t saved – it also detects and handles SPARK MAX reboots, including reapplying the settings. If any setting is found to be other than what is desired, this is flagged.

If a SPARK MAX is replaced, we only have to use the REV H/W client to set the CAN ID. Everything else, including testing out the motor, is handled through test mode.

IIRC, some settings do are not reflected until after a reboot of the SPARK MAX, such as position/velocity conversion factors, but this may have been (or may be) fixed in a F/W update. We do these particular conversions on the roboRIO to avoid this issue.

We’ve suggested REV incorporate some of these features in their code. A big one is just exposing a nice API that let’s one query or set any config parameter, in addition to a menagerie of APIs for what is now dozens of settings (some of which can’t be either set or read using these APIs).

Is there any aversion to using burnFlash() instead of what you’re doing now, with detecting motor controller reboots and re-applying settings?
Otherwise, yes, I just set the CAN ID of the Spark Max via the REV Hardware Client, then slot it into the robot, and the robot program sets it up.

I’d only burn flash in test mode, for some of the reasons that have come up here – it’s a disruptive thing to do, it’s good to minimize wear on the flash, and it’s not a quick operation. There are a few settings that are not persistent, so having the ability to detect reboots and reapply settings automatically is very nice even if everything has been burned to flash.

Also, especially for things that might be changing often (maybe coast/brake), it’s sometimes good to not persist things.
